basics.name: Jennifer J. Kim
basics.label: B.A. in Mathematics student at Cornell University. Minors in Operations Research and English.
basics.summary: Projects to Be Featured Soon: Retail Time Series Analysis, Covid Modeling, Movies Database Analysis, Traffic Stops Modeling, Seizure Modeling.

work.company: TRIPODS Research Program, University of Rochester
work.position: TRIPODS (Transdisciplinary Research In Principles Of Data Science) NSF Participant
work.summary:
Researched Kolmogorov complexity as a measure of forecastability for retail analytics time series data.
Modeled seizures and explored surrogate data testing, utilizing methods like Fast Fourier transform.
Lead weekly sections and tutor students, create assignment rubrics, grade student work.
Managed graduate carrels, assisted patrons at front desk, processed library materials.

volunteer.organization: Cornell Association for Women in Mathematics
volunteer.summary: Plan, organize, and lead all social events as undergraduate Social Events Co-Chair. Coordinate and organize community events, e.g. Julia Robinson Math Festival, as Outreach Co-Chair.

One of 500 fellows (less than 4% of undergraduates) recognized by Cornell University for 'significant work experience, campus and/or community service, and academic achievement.' Volunteer for Cornell Tradition-specific events and organizations such as Prisoner Express.

education.institution: Cornell University, College of Arts & Sciences, Ithaca, NY
education.area: Mathematics with Minors in Operations Research & English

education.institution: The Gwinnett School of Mathematics, Science, and Technology (GSMST), Lawrenceville, GA
